Welcome to HW_14_REST_API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

Create a new contact in the database based on the provided data

Parameters:

  • body – Data for creating a new contact

  • db – The SQLAlchemy session object

Returns:

Contact created

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

Retrieve a contact from the database by its ID

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Contact ID

  • db – The SQLAlchemy session object

Returns:

Contact or None if not found

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

Get list of contacts from database with limit and offset

Parameters:

  • limit – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve

  • offset – Offset to select a specific subset of contacts

  • db – The SQLAlchemy session object

Returns:

List of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

Delete a contact from the database by its ID

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to delete

  • db – The SQLAlchemy session object

Returns:

The deleted contact or None if not found

async src.repository.contacts.set_updated(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdatedModel, db: Session)¶

Set the update flag for a contact by its ID

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to set the update flag for

  • body – Data to set the update flag

  • db – The SQLAlchemy session object

Returns:

Contact or None if not found

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

Update an existing contact in the database by its ID

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update

  • body – Data to update the contact

  • db – The SQLAlchemy session object

Returns:

Updated contact or None if not found
